titleStmt.title: E. P. Thomas et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7362

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excelency the Governor of Ky

Yr Petitioner's represent that some time in 1864 Jim a Slave of R. Shuck had a difficulty with a slave of One McKenzie in which R Shuck entered into a Recognizance for his personal appearance in Henry Circt Ct -- that a forfeiture Was had and in Judt agt said Shuck at Sept Term 1865 on said Recog in Henry Circt Ct -- that a Sums has been issued for Jugt -- Now they represent that by an order of Genl Palmer of the Ky Military District said Jim was arrested & taken and permitted to go at large: that said boy Jim is without the jurisdiction of this Court -- that it has been impossible for the Bail to arrest said Jim -- they therefore pray for a dismission of the proceedings of such order from Yr Excllency & may not Subject Said Shuck to payt of the Amt $200 being amt of the Recog.

E P Thomas
J, P, Lyle
W,, V,, Shivel
J H Kitson
J R Johnston
A,, Bergen
Arthur Kenlin
J P Lyle
Joseph Magruder
M Z Ireland
J. M. Slimmons
J. W.. Slimmons
R Montgomery
Silas P Kitson
Chas Ireland
A. W. Hall
Jas. Robberts
Jno D Landrum
R C, Lindsay
J H Steedman
William Morton

Henry Cir Ct
vs
R. Shuck
$200,
Forfeiture
9th Nov/65
Remit the forfeiture
